intro: Hewittia barbeyana, commonly known as the barbeyan rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Hewittia barbeyana is noted for its hardy nature and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
